alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 7:29AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hancock and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 728 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Picayune, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Picayune and Mcneil. This includes Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 3 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.
